document.name: Family Movie Night- WC- The Cup
document.short_description:
🌟 Family Movie Night: World Cinema for Kids! 🌍🎬

Embark on a cinematic journey like never before with our Family Movie Night – an enchanting experience specially curated for the whole family!

Join us for an unforgettable evening filled with rare masterpieces from around the world, carefully selected to expand young minds and foster cultural curiosity in your little explorers.


About the movie:


"The Cup," is a 1999 Tibetan-language film directed by Khyentse Norbu. The movie is set in the Chokling Monastery in the Himalayas and follows the lives of young Tibetan Buddhist monks who are passionate about watching the World Cup football (soccer) matches. This newfound obsession with the World Cup disrupts the monks' disciplined daily routines, leading them to engage in various antics to watch the games.


Event Highlights:

-Expand Horizons with Universal Stories: Immerse your kids in a world of diverse artistic expression through rare curation of masterpieces for children.

-Foster Cultural Curiosity: Ignite curiosity about world cinema and encourage your little ones to explore the rich tapestry of global cultures through the magic of film.

-Quality Family Time: Every month, embark on a cinematic journey to a new country together, creating lasting memories and strengthening family ties.


Why Attend?

-Discover Hidden Gems: Watch movies that you might not have heard of before, carefully handpicked for their artistic superiority and engaging narratives.

-Artistically Superior Experience: Immerse your child in artistically superior films that stimulate their imagination and creativity.

-Safe Environment: Enjoy the movies in a secure and family-friendly environment, ensuring a worry-free experience for both kids and parents.


Don't miss this opportunity to create lasting memories with your family while exposing your kids to the wonders of world cinema.

Join us for Family Movie Night – where the magic of storytelling knows no bounds!

document.name: A Walk Through Khyber - 8 course set menu
document.short_description:
A Walk Through Khyber


Embark on a culinary odyssey through the vibrant tapestry of Khyber, where each dish narrates a tale of our ancestors and the legendary Silk Road. Immerse yourself in a one-of-a-kind 8-course set menu, meticulously crafted to encapsulate the essence of Khyber's rich culture and timeless flavors.


This is not merely a meal; it's a multi-sensory journey. Our menu honors the historical influences that have shaped our palate, drawing inspiration from eminent figures such as Genghis Khan and Babur. But it doesn't end with the food; we've curated every aspect, from music to decor, aromas, and textures, to offer you an immersive sensory experience. Step back in time nearly 500 years ago, as we reinterpret and celebrate the past in a contemporary light.


Pulse Hospitality x Treat


In 2020, Chef Pallavi and Chef Kartik united their culinary talents to establish Pulse Hospitality, specializing in crafting exclusive outdoor dining experiences. Now, after three successful years, they are preparing to host their very first supper club event. This noteworthy occasion is made even more special through a collaboration with Treat, an esteemed brand situated in Indiranagar, Bangalore, established in 1993 under the stewardship of Mr. Pramod Chaudhry. With its rich history spanning three decades, Treat brings a wealth of experience and expertise to this exciting partnership.

document.name: Boozy German Brunch

custom_questions.question: Number of non-veg in the group
Number of vegetarians in the group

document.short_description:
Dina's German Summers

In summer, we revel in the long days, late sunrises, and the chance to linger outdoors over drinks, hikes, and swims in cool lakes. Cycling is a popular way to get around, soaking up the extra sunshine. Outdoor concerts, cultural events, and enjoying flammkuchen are all part of the summertime fun. We gather with friends for afternoon drinks like Hugo or Radler (Sweet soda and beer mix), pack sandwiches before a refreshing swim, and fire up the grill for endless Nürnberger sausages. Of course, no summer outing is complete without a handful of Gummi bears for a sweet on-the-go treat.


Fresh fruits and berries are a summer highlight, especially those from my mom's garden. Rhubarb and berries find their way into delicious Dampfnudel (German steamed buns), a sweet and satisfying ending to a summer feast. Early summer brings the bounty of asparagus, grilled to perfection and served with a hollandaise sauce. It's a season of long days, a yearning for freedom, and light, fresh food that captures the essence of summer.


Menu


Hugo

Sparkling wine with elderflower syrup 


Rhababer

Tangy rhubarb compote with chardonnay Sabayone mousse and almond biscuit


Flammkuchen

Crisp Alsatian flat bread, Creme fraiche, leek and bacon and baby spinach(NV) / tomato(V)


Berries and cream

Tonka whipped cream, berries, hazelnut financier and limoncello syrup


Asparagus

Mama's Baby potato salad, green asparagus, hollondaise, salty cured pig cooked ham(NV) / smoked carrot (V)


Radler float

Basil strawberry sorbet in Czech pilsner 


Dampfnudel

German steam dumpling, tomato and Nürnberger sausage filling and Gouda Mornay, Pangratatto(NV) / Tofu tomato(V)


Kirsch plotzer

Moist chocolate cake with cherries and their seeds


House made Gummi bears (for your way home to summer)

document.name: 'Zarafa' Movie Screening | Family Movie Night | World Cinema
document.short_description:
Family Movie Night: World Cinema for Kids!


Join us as we watch a series of carefully curated rare masterpieces from around the world, made just for kids. All this under the night sky, while cozying up with family!


'Zarafa' follows the remarkable journey of a young Sudanese boy named Maki, who escapes from the clutches of slave traders and embarks on a quest to rescue a baby giraffe named Zarafa. Along the way, Maki encounters a kind-hearted Frenchman named Hassan, who promises to help him return Zarafa to her rightful home in Africa.


Event Highlights


Broaden Horizons with Global Tales: Dive into diverse artistic expressions through rare masterpieces curated for children.


Cultivate Cultural Curiosity: Spark interest in world cinema and inspire exploration of different cultures through the enchantment of film.


Quality Family Bonding: Embark on a cinematic journey to a new country each month, forging lasting memories and strengthening family connections.


Why Attend?


Uncover Hidden Treasures: Discover lesser-known gems handpicked for their artistic brilliance and captivating storytelling.


Artistic Excellence: Immerse your child in films of unparalleled artistic merit, fueling their imagination and creativity.


Safe Family Environment: Enjoy movies in a secure, family-friendly setting, ensuring a worry-free experience for kids and parents alike.


Don't miss this opportunity to create lasting memories with your family while exposing your kids to the wonders of world cinema.


Join us for Family Movie Night – where the magic of storytelling knows no bounds!

document.short_description:
About the movie:


"The Devil Wears Prada" follows Andy Sachs, a young woman who lands a job as an assistant to Miranda Priestly, the formidable editor-in-chief of a fashion magazine. As Andy navigates the demanding world of high fashion, she learns valuable lessons about ambition, loyalty, and the true cost of success. With standout performances from Meryl Streep and Anne Hathaway, the film offers a witty and entertaining exploration of the fashion industry's glamour and challenges.



3-Course Menu


Course 1

Corn Chowder 


Course 2

Chicken Breast, Roast Potatoes and Mustard Cream Sauce 

OR 

Vegetarian Moussaka 


Course 3

document.name: Kids Playdate | Dragons Love Tacos
document.short_description:
Ticket Includes All Activities by The LooRoo Club for One Kid and One accompanying parent

Who is it for?

Children aged 3-8 years accompanied by one adult who can join in the play alongside their child at no additional cost.


About the Playdate


This playdate is centered around the New York Times bestseller, "Dragons Love Tacos" by Adam Rubin! This story is a hit with us because it combines two of our favorite things: dragons and tacos. Get ready for a day filled with fun activities like making dragon crafts, whipping up tasty salsa (mild, of course!), and throwing an epic taco party that even dragons would love!


But wait, there's more fun to come! We'll also recreate the structures inspired by what the dragons built after their fiery adventures in the book because every dragon needs a cozy spot to hang out.


And to wrap it all up, we'll feast on delicious tacos together. Join us for a day of laughter, creativity, and lots of taco love, just like the parties dragons love to have!


Terms and Conditions


  • The management bears no responsibility for any injury or damage incurred during the event.
  • Purchase tickets exclusively from the designated ticketing platform.
  • No refunds for no-shows or cancellations under any circumstances.
  • Tickets are non-transferable and intended for personal use only.
  • Event schedule and menu subject to change in case of emergencies or events beyond our control.
  • The management will not entertain liability claims arising from the consumption of food or beverages.
  • Parking near the event venue is at the vehicle owner's risk. Paid valet parking available at Rs. 200 per car.
  • Ticket holders grant organizers perpetual rights to use any recorded video or still footage of their appearance on any channel, without further approval.

document.short_description:
KAPPŌ RYŌRI 割烹料理


The kappō style of dining can be considered like a middle ground between Kaiseki cuisine served at a high-end Ryōtei and cheap snacky food served at an Izakaya. 

Back in those days, Kappō was a term used to refer to an establishment where the guest was not allowed to invite a Geisha as opposed to a Ryōtei where a Geisha could be invited. 

Kappō in modern day, refers to an eatery which is more polished than an Izakaya and sophisticated with its offerings ranging from snacky food to almost kaiseki like dishes. At the same time a Kappō isn’t as uptight and formal as a Kaiseki Ryōtei. 

Food is sometimes served a la carte and sometimes from a set menu. It is more casual compared to a kaiseki meal and the use of garlic, onions and other alliums are not restricted. 


As compared to a kaiseki where most seating is in private tatami rooms called the Ozashiki, Kappō restaurants look like any other restaurant in the west, with tables and counter seats, usually allowing guests to see the chef and food being prepared. It also allows for a casual chit-chat.


Set Menu


Non-vegtarian Menu: ﻿


SAKIZUKE 先付け

Assortment of small appetisers 

Asparagus bacon yawatamaki, Sobagaki mudde with fukinotō miso, Moringa dashimaki omelette

アスパラベーコン巻き、蕎麦がきの蕗のとう味噌風かけ、モリンガだし巻き玉子

 

OTSUKURI お造り

Sashimi course 

Otoshibumi sashimi of hamachi and red snapper with tomato plum umadashi 

落とし文。トマトと梅干しの旨出汁を添えた鰤と鯛の昆布締め


OWAN お椀

Lacquered lidded bowl course showcasing dashi

Shiromiso jitate Ozōni. Grilled mochi, shiitake, vegetables and yuzu in a dashi blended with white saikyō miso by GroundUp made with himachali beans. 

インド産の西京味噌風クラフト白味噌仕立てお雑煮。


YAKIMONO 焼き物

Grilled course 

Japanese style seafood gratin with ikura, scallops, prawns and fish 

海鮮グラタン。魚の荒で取った出汁を使用


MUSHIMONO 蒸し物

Steamed course 

Pork Hanbāgu, in-house tonkatsu sauce made with 13 vegetables and fruits 

ハンバーグ。13の野菜と果物で作った自家製ソース。


AGEMONO 揚げ物

Fried course 

Katsuo Chicken Karaage dusted with yamazansho

鰹節と鶏の唐揚げ


SHIIZAKANA 強肴

A course meant to go well with drinks, literally.

Buta no kakuni. A classic dish of grilled and simmered pork.  

豚の角煮


TOMEWAN 止め椀

Final carb course 

Hiyashi chūka cold noodle salad with handmade alkaline noodles, a refreshing ice cold citrus soup, chilled and juicy summery toppings 

自家製麺の冷やし中華


KANMI 甘味

Dessert 

Castella pudding with coconut ice cream 

カステラプリンとテンダーココナッツアイス


Vegetarian Menu


SAKIZUKE 先付け

Assortment of small appetisers 

Asparagus wrapped in yuba-soymilk skins, Sobagaki mudde with fukinotō miso, Gomadōfu tofu made with sesame milk, coconut and bracken.

アスパラ湯葉巻き、蕎麦がきの蕗のとう味噌風かけ、ココナッツ入り胡麻豆腐

 

OTSUKURI お造り

Sashimi course 

Otoshibumi sashimi of pickled tomatoes and avocado 

落とし文。トマトとアボカドの刺身。


OWAN お椀

Lacquered lidded bowl course showcasing dashi

Shiromiso jitate Ozōni. Grilled mochi, shiitake, vegetables and yuzu in a dashi blended with white saikyō miso by GroundUp made with himachali beans. 

インド産の西京味噌風クラフト白味噌仕立てお雑煮。


YAKIMONO 焼き物

Grilled course 

Japanese style vegetable gratin made with vegetable dashi.

野菜グラタン


MUSHIMONO 蒸し物

Steamed course 

Sakamushi vegetables. Simple vegetables steamed with sake in hinoki japanese cypress wood masu-boxes. Served with a refreshing sesame sauce. 

野菜の酒蒸し。胡麻ポン酢ソース添え


AGEMONO 揚げ物

Fried course 

Sweet potato korokke 

さつま芋コロッケと13の野菜と果物の自家製豚カツソース


SHIIZAKANA 強肴

A course meant to go well with drinks, literally.

Mābō nasu. Chinese dish that’s popularly consumed in Japan. A spicy saucy dish of fried aubergines, tofu and soy mince.

麻婆茄子


TOMEWAN 止め椀

Final carb course 

Hiyashi chūka cold noodle salad with handmade alkaline noodles, a refreshing ice cold citrus soup, chilled and juicy summery toppings 

自家製麺の冷やし中華


KANMI 甘味

Dessert 

Castella with coconut ice cream 

カステラとテンダーココナッツアイス

document.short_description:
Board Game Evening!

Hello there! Come hang out with us at Together's Board Game Evening this Saturday! A super chill evening packed with games laughter and fun.


Whether you're a pro strategist or just playing for fun there's something for everyone. No stress if you're unfamiliar with the board games – we've got your back we'll guide you through!


MARK YOU CALENDARS

Date: Every Saturday

Time: 7 pm - 10pm

Fees: 249/- per person

Location - 5th Floor Hoda Workspace

30/A 14th cross 9th Main Rd Sector 6 HSR Layout Bengaluru Karnataka 560102 India


Experience:


  • Engaging Board Games
  • Lively Atmosphere


Reserve your spot now or simply walk in and experience an amazing evening together with us. Let's make this Saturday one to remember!

account_data.company_description: We curate nature-inspired, play-based activity kits and workshops for children

document.address: Maratt Estate, Bannerghatta Rd, Dollar Layout, Phase 4, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India
document.booking_confirmation_message:
Hi,


Thank you for signing up for the Seas the day play date on April 13th at URU Brewpark in J.P Nagar! We’ve received your payment and we’re very excited to see you and your little one at the party!


A few things to take note of while you attend a workshop by The LooRoo Club:


  • The workshop is from 10:30 am to 12:30 pm
  • Our workshops are curated for one adult and a child.
  • Through the workshop, we encourage an adult (parent/caretaker) to be around, and will be happier if they played along as well :) The adult will be responsible for the child.
  • Our play dates may get messy sometimes - think water, paints, clay, mud, eco-slime. We encourage parents to carry an extra pair of clothes with them.
  • The workshop is organised outdoors, so if you’d like to bring a hat, water, sunscreen or mosquito repellent along, please do.
  • If your child has any allergies to nuts/seeds or any of the materials used during the workshop, please do let us know.


Looking forward to seeing you!


Love

The LooRoo Club

document.name: Seas The Day
document.short_description:
In oceans deep, where tales are spun,

Mermaids dance beneath the sun.

Pirates brave with hearts so bold,

Chasing treasures, stories untold.


Ahoy, young hearts, come one, come all!

Our vessel charts a course for the URU Brewpark on April 13th for an epic play date filled with treasure hunts, mermaid lagoon explorations, and daring pirate escapades.


Secure your spot on the plank or in the mermaid's cove – Book your slot now before the tide sweeps them away!

custom_questions.question: Number of vegetarians in the group
Number of Non- Vegetarians in the group

document.short_description:
Menu


Amuse 

Escabeche 

(House pickled veggies) with Cream & Onion Dip.


Tacos 


1. Shroom Quesa Birria 

(Fresh corn tortilla stuffed with Slow Roasted Wild mushrooms, Cheese & Red Onions served with Spicy Ancho Chilli Consommé)


2. Lamb Quesa Birria

(Fresh corn tortilla stuffed with Slow cooked Lamb, Cheese & Red Onions served with Spicy Ancho Chilli Consommé)


3. Carnitas de Pollo

(8 hour slow cooked Chicken marinated in Orange juice & Fresh Oregano, Pickled onions, Charred Jalapeño, Cilantro Salsa)


4. Cochinita pibil 

(Yucatan style BBQ Pork Leg wrapped in Banana leaf, Orange juice pickled onion & jalapeño slaw, Salsa El Diablo with a side of Chicharrones)


5. Suadero 

(Tallow confit Beef Brisket, Salsa Roja, Tomatillo Verde & Pico de gallo)


Tostadas


1. Sweet potato & Black Bean 

(Charcoal Roasted Sweet Potato, Black beans, Avocado Mayo, Pickled Peppers & Charred Corn-Cialntro Salsa)


2. Aguachille De Pescado

(Fish & Prawn marinated in Gooseberry Salsa with Garlic Cream, Cucumber & Dill Slaw, Crush nachos & Avocados)


3. Huevos rancheros 

(Chorizo Chilli, Marbled egg, Salsa Roja, Crumble feta, Bacon Salsa macha & Avocados)


Dessert 


1. Sopaipillas

with Caramelised Bananas, Dulce de leche & Crema Fresca


2. Bionico

Street style Dessert Cups with Fresh fruit, Ice cream, Granola & Coconut


Terms and Conditions :

  • The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an event.
  • Do not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.
  • Each slot, lasting 2 hours only, requires attendance at the booked time, with no accommodation for attendance at any other slot except the one booked.
  • No shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.
  • Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.
  • The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.
  • Children over 3 years of age require a ticket.
  • No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.
  • Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.
  • Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.
  • The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval of theirs.
